name: nutrient supply from potassium chloride sludge | inorganic potassium fertiliser, as K2O | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22393/documentation

This inventory describes the supply of nutrients from ''potassium chloride sludge'' for fertiliser use. ;;No machinery expenditures or emissions to the environment are considered related to the actual application of this substance on soil during its agricultural use. The purpose of this activity is to connect the production of ''potassium chloride sludge'' with its generic uses as fertiliser. The product ''potassium chloride sludge'' is connected to the generic market for "inorganic potassium fertiliser, as K2O" through this supplying activity. In the agricultural context, ''potassium chloride sludge'' can be used directly as a fertilizer input to crop production, eventually with other chemicals; alternatively, a generic input of "inorganic potassium fertiliser, as K2O" can be used instead, and this will represent the regional consumption mix for his type of nutrient. A way in between is allowed by using the generic input "inorganic potassium fertiliser, as K2O" and link to the activity providing it from a specific chemical.;; In all cases, emissions associated to the application of the fertilizer have to be calculated in the crop production activity."

Activity starting with the application of potassium chloride sludge.

The activity ends with the provision of K-fertiliser.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0161:Support activities for crop production

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: inventory based on composition of potassium chloride sludge
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Dataset based on nutrient content of ash, from combustion of bagasse from sugar cane for fertiliser use

exchanges.description: The sludge has a K2O content of 70%.
